The General Instrument Corporation disclosed that it had been approached by an unidentified financial concern seeking information about the New York-based electronics company. The disclosure came as Forstmann Little & Company formally began its friendly $1.6 billion tender offer for the company.

In documents filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, General Instrument said the company's management had been directed to provide the data to the third party, subject to the execution of a confidentiality agreement.
